books.title: The Happiness Advantage
books.author: Shawn Achor
books.description: The book that changed how I prioritize everything in my life. I now aim to be happier and healthier so I can bring more of that into the world.

books.title: Recoding America
books.author: Jennifer Pahlka
books.description: My favorite book in the last few years. Pahlka expertly describes how government culture, not the individuals, fails the American people and how to fix it.

books.title: Lean Startup
books.author: Eric Ries
books.description: A startup fundamental, Ries argues that building is about learning and validating hypotheses. Now I recognize that building without learning is a waste for a startup.

books.title: The Innovator's Dilemma
books.author: Clayton M. Christensen
books.description: A classic business book. Christensen asserts that incumbents chase higher and higher revenues, ignoring the needs of emerging markets. Startups therefore are best positioned to disrupt the market.

books.title: No Rules Rules
books.author: Reid Hoffman
books.description: A book about how to build a culture of innovation. Hoffman argues that freedom and responsibility foster more innovation than a process and controls.

books.title: The Mom Test
books.author: Rob Fitzpatrick
books.description: A must read for any entrepreneur. Fitzpatrick, an engineer, teaches you how to validate your idea before you build it.

books.title: What you do is who you are
books.author: Anthony Horowitz
books.description: A book that describes culture as the sum of the behaviors of the people in the organization. Leaders must be aware their actions will be emulated.

books.title: Good to Great
books.author: Jim Collins
books.description: Jim Collins describes his studies on what differentiates great companies from good ones. It starts with having the right people along with a culture of discipline.

books.title: An American Sickness
books.author: Elisabeth Rosenthal
books.description: Rosenthal lists many examples of the misaligned incentives in the Healthcare industry. While I agree with many of the problems, I think innovation will come from new business models rather than policy.

books.title: The Innovator's Prescription
books.author: Clayton M. Christensen
books.description: From the author of The Innovator's Dilemma, this book is nearly a textbook on how to lower costs and create efficiency in healthcare. It is the best argument for value-based care I have read.

books.title: Hacking Growth
books.author: Sean Ellis
books.description: An essential for any entrepreneuer who sells d2c. Ellis teaches a framework for rapidly testing and iterating on growth levers. Jared Flamm used this at Blueberry and saved the company from running out of cash.

books.title: Where Does It Hurt?
books.author: Jonathan Bush
books.description: A book targeted towards entrepreneurs describing where the problems are in healthcare, and what founders can do to solve them.
